author: CALI

core_concepts.definition: The addition of new facts will not invalidate old conclusions.
A conclusion, once reached, remains valid as long as its premises are not altered.
The system can only reason with the information it currently possesses; it cannot draw conclusions from data it hasn't seen.

learning_principles: Once a fact is known, it is always known.
Do not discard old knowledge when new knowledge arrives.
Build on existing truths rather than seeking to overturn them.
